title: TC001-Verify portfolio renders correctly across multiple screen sizes
description: Ensure that the portfolio layout and all sections (Hero, About, Skills, Projects, Contact) render properly and are visually distinct on desktop, tablet, and mobile devices with no layout breaking or content overlap.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Scroll down to check visibility and layout of About, Skills, Projects, and Contact sections on desktop.
        await page.mouse.wheel(0, 1000)
        

        # -> Resize viewport to tablet screen size and verify responsive layout.
        await page.goto('http://localhost:3000/', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # -> Resize viewport to tablet screen size and verify responsive layout with no horizontal scrolling or missing content.
        await page.goto('http://localhost:3000/', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # -> Resize viewport to tablet screen size and verify responsive layout with no horizontal scrolling or missing content.
        await page.goto('http://localhost:3000/', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # -> Resize viewport to tablet screen size and verify responsive layout with no horizontal scrolling or missing content.
        await page.goto('http://localhost:3000/', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # -> Resize viewport to tablet screen size and verify responsive layout with no horizontal scrolling or missing content.
        await page.goto('http://localhost:3000/', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        await page.mouse.wheel(0, 1000)
        

        # -> Resize viewport to tablet screen size and verify responsive layout with no horizontal scrolling or missing content.
        await page.goto('http://localhost:3000/', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        await page.mouse.wheel(0, 1000)
        

        # -> Resize viewport to tablet screen size and verify responsive layout with no horizontal scrolling or missing content.
        await page.goto('http://localhost:3000/', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        await page.mouse.wheel(0, 1000)
        

        # -> Resize viewport to tablet screen size and verify responsive layout with no horizontal scrolling or missing content.
        await page.mouse.wheel(0, 1000)
        

        # -> Resize viewport to tablet screen size and verify responsive layout with no horizontal scrolling or missing content.
        await page.mouse.wheel(0, 500)
        

        # -> Resize viewport to tablet screen size and verify responsive layout with no horizontal scrolling or missing content.
        await page.goto('http://localhost:3000/', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        await page.mouse.wheel(0, 1000)
        

        # -> Resize viewport to tablet screen size and verify responsive layout with no horizontal scrolling or missing content.
        await page.goto('http://localhost:3000/', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        await page.mouse.wheel(0, 1000)
        

        # -> Resize viewport to tablet screen size and verify responsive layout with no horizontal scrolling or missing content.
        await page.mouse.wheel(0, 500)
        

        # -> Resize viewport to tablet screen size and verify responsive layout with no horizontal scrolling or missing content.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click 'Services' link to check navigation and layout on tablet view
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/header/nav/div/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Portfolio Layout Verified Successfully').first).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError('Test plan execution failed: Portfolio layout and all sections (Hero, About, Skills, Projects, Contact) did not render properly or are not visually distinct across desktop, tablet, and mobile devices, indicating layout breaking or content overlap.')
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

title: TC003-Test GSAP ScrollTrigger animations on section titles and contents
description: Verify that GSAP scroll-based animations trigger smoothly as the user scrolls through each portfolio section and content reveals as intended without performance issues or glitches.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Scroll slowly from top to bottom to observe animations triggering on each portfolio section's title and content.
        await page.mouse.wheel(0, 3000)
        

        # -> Scroll quickly up and down multiple times to verify animations refresh and trigger correctly without errors.
        await page.mouse.wheel(0, -1500)
        

        await page.mouse.wheel(0, 1500)
        

        await page.mouse.wheel(0, -1500)
        

        await page.mouse.wheel(0, 1500)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Atmos Studio').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Pulse Health').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Nova XR').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)

title: TC008-Validate that Next.js build trace file captures timing events
description: Inspect the .next/trace file to verify it logs client, server, and edge build pipeline timing events correctly for performance and debugging purposes.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Open the .next/trace file after a successful build
        await page.goto('http://localhost:3000/.next/trace', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        try:
            await expect(page.locator('text=Build pipeline completed successfully').first).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError("Test case failed: The .next/trace file does not contain expected timing records for client, server, and edge build pipelines as required by the test plan.")
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/main/section[6]/div/form/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('Test User')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input email in contact form
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/main/section[6]/div/form/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('testuser@example.com')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input message in contact form
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/main/section[6]/div/form/div[3]/textarea').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('Testing ScrollTrigger failure handling.')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click Send Message button to test form submission stability
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/main/section[6]/div/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=ScrollTrigger registered successfully').first).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError("Test failed: GSAP ScrollTrigger failed to register due to script loading errors. The app should handle this gracefully without crashing or freezing and log meaningful errors, but the expected success message was not found.")
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())
